name: Ma il cielo è sempre più blu
description:
Data visualization about the emissions produced by the incinerator in Brescia city.
For each of the 21 pollutants corresponds a color taken as a sample from the tower designed by the artist Jorrit Tornquist.
Later, the quantities associated with each chemical are added up and translated into percentages.
The resulting images consist of different shades of blue and their final print density is determined by the numeric values examined. These peaceful and clear “skies” are nothing but deceptive images, originated by data that probably need to be more transparent. Eventually, in this play on chromatic nuances, the visual element takes over the content, which is already almost intangible, due to its nature.
